refnamediv.refpurpose: a class that indicates whether two summands of an mCRL2 LPE are syntactically disjoint

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
Two summands are syntactically disjoint if the following conditions hold:
The set of variables used by one summand is disjoint from the set of variables changed by the other summand and vice versa.
The set of variables changed by one summand is disjoint from the set of variables changed by the other summand.
An instance of the class &class_disjointness_checker; is created using the constructor &disjointness_checker_constructor;. The parameter &par_process_equations; is used to pass the summands to be checked for disjointness. The function &disjointness_checker_disjoint; indicates whether the two summands with numbers &par_summand_number_1; and &par_summand_number_2; are syntactically disjoint.

refsect1.title: Preconditions
refsect1.para:
The following precondition has to be satisfied for &disjointness_checker_constructor;:
the argument passed as parameter &par_process_equations; is a specification of process equations in mCRL2 format
the arguments passed as parameters &par_summand_number_1; and &par_summand_number_2; correspond to summands in the proces equations passed as parameter &par_process_equations;. They lie in the interval from and including 1 upto and including the highest summand number
